content:
/>
III.i.2.C.1.d
.
Concluding Federal Records Do Not Exist or Further Efforts Would be Futile
Determine on a case-by-case basis whether the requested Federal records do not exist or further attempts to obtain records would be futile based on
completion of at least the minimum efforts specified in
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 1.A.1.b
, and/or
any response received from the records custodian.
Important
:
DD Form 2963,
Service Treatment Record (STR) Transfer or Certification
is a certification of the completeness of all available STRs at discharge from service.  Treat this, or a predecessor certification letter, as a statement from the records custodian that it is reasonably certain that additional STRs do not exist and further attempts to obtain additional records would be futile except as provided in
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.A.2.c
.
References
:  For more information on
locating, and migration of, STRs, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.A
the procedures for obtaining STRs, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.B
, and
refraining from or discontinuing assistance, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 1.A.4.b
.
title: M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section C - Duty to Assist With Obtaining Records
citation: Part III, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section C
